text.p: EDMONTON, March 13 /CNW/ - Stanley Technology Group Inc. today announced fourth quarter earnings for the period October 1 to December 31, 1996, and the results of operations for fiscal 1996.

"We are pleased that 1996 was a very positive year on many important fronts for the company," said Ron Triffo, President and CEO of Stanley Technology Group. "We have made a strong recovery from 1995 levels and anticipate 1997 will be a year of significant opportunities."

Net income for the year increased to $4,323,000 or $0.73 per share compared to $3,363,000 or $0.57 per share in the previous year. This 29% increase resulted in earnings that were the second highest in the company's history. Gross revenue grew by nearly 23% to $116,124,000 in 1996, compared to $94,425,000 in 1995, marking the first time the company's gross revenue has exceeded $100 million. Fourth quarter earnings per share of $0.26 were 73% better than the $0.15 per share achieved in the comparable quarter in 1995. Gross revenue for this quarter was $33,042,000 compared to $25,003,000 in 1995 with net income for the last quarter of 1996 increasing to $1,553,000 compared to $865,000 for the same period in 1995.

Ron Triffo further noted: "We have continued to increase our diversification of services and strengthen our market position through acquisition of firms in both Canada and the United States. As the general economic outlook throughout North America improves so will the demand for our services. Having worked in over 80 countries, Stanley Technology Group is also well equipped to provide its engineering, planning, management and scientific consulting expertise to the global market."

Stanley Technology Group Inc. is a professional consulting firm offering engineering, planning, management and scientific services in North America and internationally. The shares of Stanley Technology Group Inc. are traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol STG.
